00049 #ifndef _FC_FILE_IO_H_
00050 #define _FC_FILE_IO_H_
00051 
00052 #ifdef __cplusplus
00053 extern "C" {
00054 #endif
00055 
00056 /** \name File IO enumerated type. */
00057 //-------------------------------
00058 //@{
00059 
00060 /**
00061  * \ingroup FileIO
00062  * \brief Types of file formats for dataset file IO
00063  *
00064  * \description
00065  *
00066  *    All possible file types are defined, but not all may be available
00067  *    in a specific installation.
00068  *
00069  *    NOTE: purposefully do not have this type stuff in base.h because
00070  *    then only this set of files (fileio) needs to be modified if
00071  *    different format types are available.
00072  *
00073  * \todo ? Add html pointers for each type?
00074  * \todo ? Is the NOTE above true? move this & helpers to base.h?
00075  *
00076  * \modifications
00077  *    - 7/13/05 WSD Created.
00078  */
00079 typedef enum {
00080   FC_FT_NONE = 0,   /**< Type not specified */
00081   FC_FT_EXODUS,     /**< Exodus II */
00082   FC_FT_LSDYNA,     /**< LS-DYNA */
00083 } FC_FileIOType;
00084 
00085 //@}
00086 
00087 // helpers
00088 int fc_isFileIOTypeValid(FC_FileIOType fileType);
00089 char* fc_getFileIOTypeText(FC_FileIOType fileType);
00090 int fc_isFileIOTypeReadSupported(FC_FileIOType fileType);
00091 int fc_isFileIOTypeWriteSupported(FC_FileIOType fileType);
00092 
00093 // Load dataset
00094 // FIX? someday add r/w option
00095 FC_ReturnCode fc_loadDataset(char *filename, FC_Dataset *dataset);
00096 FC_ReturnCode fc_loadDatasetWithFormat(char *filename, FC_FileIOType fileType,
00097                FC_Dataset *dataset);
00098 
00099 // Write dataset
00100 // FIX? add a clobber option?
00101 FC_ReturnCode fc_writeDataset(FC_Dataset dataset, char* filename,
00102                FC_FileIOType fileType);
00103 FC_ReturnCode fc_rewriteDataset(FC_Dataset dataset, char* filename,
00104                FC_FileIOType fileType);
00105 
00106 // Other
00107 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDatasetFileIOType(FC_Dataset dataset, 
00108                         FC_FileIOType *fileType);
00109 
00110 #ifdef __cplusplus
00111 }
